alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; McIntosh; Muskogee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 7:44AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Haskell, northeastern McIntosh, western Sequoyah, south central Cherokee and eastern Muskogee Counties through 815 AM CST... At 744 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles south of Keefeton to Porum to 4 miles east of Enterprise. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Tahlequah... Stigler... Warner... Vian... Gore... Porum... Webbers Falls... Whitefield... Braggs... Tamaha... Briartown... Greenleaf State Park... Pumpkin Center... Cookson... Lake Tenkiller State Park... Keefeton... Kanima... Box... Mc Key... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 272 and 301. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
